text: On our show, recipes for baked goods, such as melon buns, are very popular!
In addition to rice, baked goods are also popular in Japan.
Sliced bread for breakfast,
baked confectionaries for snack time,
and savory pastries that serve as small meals.
Japan has all kinds of baked goods.
I asked around to see which ones are the most popular.
Here are the results!
Our question for overseas viewers: Have you ever eaten Japanese baked goods?
Please let us know your favorites in the comments section of our channel.
All this talk of baked goods is making me hungry...
It looks like it might rain, but I think I'll go out for a stroll.
Chef gave me a new umbrella, so I am prepared.
My foodie friend has given me a list of the best bakeries Japan has to offer.
Let's check them out!
Tada~
My first time in Shimokitazawa!
Uh-oh, I seem to be lost.
Do you know a bakery called Anzerika (Angelica)?
Ah!  Here it is!
What item do you recommend?
What time are they usually ready by?
Hey!  It's me!
This is great!  I will definitely come and visit again!
If you find yourself in Shimokitazawa, be sure to try Anzerika's miso bun.
It's sweet and savory at the same time!
Even if it rains, Chef's umbrella will protect me.
